title: Caduceus of the Rheginoi
support: A bronze caduceus consisting of staff surmounted by Ionic capital supporting a pair of entwined snakes.

layout.p: The text is written on one side of the upper part of the staff, below the head.

date._: First half of the 5th century BCE

provenanceFound._: Found in contrada Civita in the early 1960s (possibly ancient )

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

museum.name: Museo Civico Gaetano Savasta
museum.description: A small series of display cases containing material from Neolithic to recent times, from excavations in the local area: San Marco, Poggio Monaco, Monte Castellaccio, Poggio Cocola and the Collina Storica. Principally ceramics, with some small finds

location.address: Piazza Martiri d�Ungheria 1, ex Carcere Borbonico, 95047 - Patern� (CT)
